segment_metadata.text_identification: This appears to be from the New Testament, likely from one of Paul's letters, specifically Galatians.
segment_metadata.text_summary: This passage recounts Paul's interactions with other apostles and churches after his conversion. He describes his initial obscurity to the Judean churches, his subsequent visit to Jerusalem with Barnabas and Titus, and his confrontation with Peter (Cephas) in Antioch. A key point is the acceptance of Paul's ministry to the Gentiles, while Peter ministered to the circumcised. Paul also discusses the issue of false brothers who sought to undermine the freedom in Christ and the importance of maintaining the truth of the gospel. He confronts Peter for hypocrisy in separating himself from Gentile believers due to fear of those from the circumcision party, emphasizing that justification comes through faith in Christ, not works of the law.
